messages.content: Thank you for calling Nestlé customer service. My name is Betrace. May I know your name, please?
Hi Betrace, this is Ian. I'm really frustrated with the Purina Pro Plan I bought. The package arrived damaged, and I need this sorted out immediately.
I'm really sorry to hear that, Ian. I understand your frustration. Could you please provide me with the details of the damage and any order information you have?
The box was ripped open, and the contents were all over the place. I couldn't even use it. Order number is 123456789.
Thank you for providing the order number, Ian. I'll look into this right away. While I check, could you also let me know if you've taken any photos of the damaged package?
Yes, I took some photos. I can send them over if needed. But what's the point? I just want this fixed!

I completely understand, Ian. The photos will help us expedite the process. Could you please send them to our customer service email at support@nestle.com? In the meantime, I'll start the process for a replacement order.
Alright, I'll send them now. But seriously, this is the last time I'm dealing with this if it doesn't get resolved quickly.
I assure you, Ian, we'll handle this as swiftly as possible. Once we receive the photos, I'll confirm the replacement order and ensure it's shipped out to you immediately.
Fine, I'm sending the photos now. Just get this sorted.
Thank you, Ian. Our team will process this urgently. You'll receive a confirmation email shortly. If there's anything else I can assist you with, please let me know.
